designScenario.name: Radio Navigation System
designScenario.description: A specialized navigation system utilizing radio signals from ground-based navigation aids (e.g., VOR, ILS, NDB) and satellite systems to determine aircraft position, enable course guidance, and support approach procedures. Integrates multiple radio navigation sources with avionics for lateral and vertical path adherence in all flight phases.

details.description: The system shall automatically tune and decode VOR, ILS, DME, and ADF signals for navigation reference.
Provide bearing/distance calculations relative to ground-based navigation aids with error compensation for magnetic variation.
Maintain VOR radial tracking accuracy within ±1.5° under normal signal conditions.
Process ILS localizer and glidepath signals with ≤0.25° deviation sensitivity during CAT I approaches.
Implement dual-channel cross-verification for critical approach signals (ILS/DME) with automatic failover.
Trigger cockpit alerts when navigation signal quality falls below ICAO Annex 10 minimums.
Support ARINC 429/708 data interfaces for integration with legacy and modern avionics suites.
Design antennas and receivers to meet DO-160G environmental standards for EMI/lightning protection.

systemComponents.name: VOR Receiver
systemComponents.description: Very High Frequency Omnidirectional Range receiver for azimuth determination relative to ground stations

subComponents.name: VOR Tuner
subComponents.description: Frequency-selective unit for station selection (108-117.95 MHz)

subComponents.name: Phase Comparator
subComponents.description: Calculates phase difference between reference and variable signals for bearing resolution

systemComponents.name: ILS Receiver
systemComponents.description: Instrument Landing System receiver for precision approach guidance

subComponents.name: Localizer Receiver
subComponents.description: Processes 108-112 MHz signals for lateral guidance

subComponents.name: Glidepath Receiver
subComponents.description: Processes UHF (329.3-335 MHz) signals for vertical approach path

systemComponents.name: DME Transponder
systemComponents.description: Distance Measuring Equipment for slant-range calculation to ground stations

subComponents.name: Time Interval Counter
subComponents.description: Measures round-trip signal delay for distance calculation

systemComponents.name: Radio Navigation Computer
systemComponents.description: Central processor integrating multiple radio navigation inputs with flight management data

subComponents.name: Signal Fusion Module
subComponents.description: Kalman filter-based integration of VOR/ILS/DME data with inertial references

subComponents.name: Fault Detection Unit
subComponents.description: Continuous monitoring of signal validity and equipment health

systemComponents.name: Antenna Array
systemComponents.description: Aircraft-mounted antennas for radio signal reception

subComponents.name: VOR/ILS Blade Antenna
subComponents.description: Vertically polarized antenna for VHF navigation signals

relationships.description: Navigation computer aggregates bearing data from multiple VOR receivers for position triangulation
ILS receiver is an integral component managed directly by the navigation computer during approaches
DME distance data is transmitted to the navigation computer for position updating
VOR receiver depends on antenna array for signal reception quality
Requires updated navigation database for station frequencies/positions

attributes.description: Navigation data refresh rate for different flight phases

attributes.name: redundancy

attributes.description: Redundant signal paths for critical approach phases
